gestureListeners.transformation

Class Displacement3DVerticalListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • gestureListeners.transformation.Displacement3DVerticalListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener

    public class Displacement3DVerticalListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener
    This class lets you displace objects of type AbstractGUIComponent along a vector which you can specify. This means, you can move an arbitrary GUI-component along an arbitrary vector which cuts the position of the GUI-component. This lets you move an object in 3-dimensional space using just one degree of freedom, so this complements nicely with the ordinary Displacement3DListener which gives you 2 dof in 3 dimensional space.
    Version:
    20110924
    Author:
    langenhagen

        public Displacement3DVerticalListener(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D direction,
                              org.mt4j.components.MTComponent comp)
        Constructor #1
        Creates a new listener with the speceified direction relative to the given component's space. If the given component is null, the listener just user global coordinate space.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction a Vector3D
        comp - The component specifying the coordinate space as an MTComponent

      • setDirectionVector

        public void setDirectionVector(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D direction,
                      org.mt4j.components.MTComponent comp)
        Sets the direction vector according to the given one in the coordinate system of the specified component. If the given component is null, global coordinaes are assumed.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction vector as a Vector3D
        comp - The component specifying the coordinate space as an MTComponent

      • setDirectionVector

        public void setDirectionVector(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D direction)
        Sets the movement-direction according to the specified vector in global coordinate space.
        Parameters:
        direction - The new axis vector of the repositioning-plane as a Vector3D
